intro: Ayapana haughtii, commonly known as the red spider lily, is a striking plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant red flowers that resemble spiders, hence its common name. The plant features strap-like, evergreen leaves that are broad and glossy, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Ayapana haughtii thrives in well-drained soil and requires partial to full sunlight for optimal growth. Its unique appearance and hardy nature make it a popular choice for gardens and botanical collections.
